tool.name: AccessCalcPro2_4_multi

param.name: network
param.dialogReference: The input Network Analyst network dataset for your analysis

param.name: travel_mode
param.dialogReference: The travel mode for your analysis from your network dataset; travel impedance must be in minutes

param.name: cutoff
param.dialogReference: The travel time (in minutes) value at which to stop searching for destinations for a given origin

param.name: time_of_day
param.dialogReference: A time and date of departure from the origins; useful for analyses with traffic or GTFS transit scheduling

param.name: impedance_list
param.dialogReference: A selection of one or more impedance measures from the power (POW), negative exponential (EXP), modified Gaussian (MGAUS), cumulative rectangular (CUMR) or cumulative linear (CUML) families; refer to the paper Accessibility Toolbox for R and ArcGIS at DOI https://doi.org/10.32866/8416 for guidance on selecting a measure

param.name: origins_i_input
param.dialogReference: A feature class representing origin locations i; can be point, line, or polygon

param.name: i_id
param.dialogReference: A unique identifier for your input origins; can be any type of field

param.name: search_tolerance_i
param.dialogReference: The search tolerance for locating the input features on the network; features that are outside the search tolerance are left unlocated

param.name: search_criteria_i
param.dialogReference: Restricts the search to particular source feature classes in your network dataset; useful if you don't want to find features that may be unsuited for a network location

param.name: search_query_i
param.dialogReference: Specifies a query to restrict the search to a subset of the features within a network source feature class; useful if you don't want to locate on particular features

param.name: destinations_j_input
param.dialogReference: A feature class representing destination locations j; can be point, line, or polygon

param.name: j_id
param.dialogReference: A unique identifier for your input destinations; can be any type of field

param.name: opportunities_j
param.dialogReference: A numeric field containing the opportunities Oj available at the destination, such as the number of jobs

param.name: search_tolerance_j
param.dialogReference: The search tolerance for locating the input features on the network; features that are outside the search tolerance are left unlocated

param.name: search_criteria_j
param.dialogReference: Restricts the search to particular source feature classes in your network dataset; useful if you don't want to find features that may be unsuited for a network location

param.name: search_query_j
param.dialogReference: Specifies a query to restrict the search to a subset of the features within a network source feature class; useful if you don't want to locate on particular features

param.name: output_dir
param.dialogReference: The folder where the output geodatabase will be created; working files generated during large analyses can require many gigabytes of disk space

param.name: output_gdb
param.dialogReference: Name for the output geodatabase containing the scratch working files and the final tool output

param.name: batch_size_factor
param.dialogReference: Maximum size of each batch of origins for multiprocessing and controlling memory/disk use; some optimization may occur if the number of observations can be spread over the available processes within your set maximum batch size

param.name: del_i_eq_j
param.displayname: Delete OD lines where i equals j?
param.dialogReference: If selected, the tool will delete any origin-destination lines or pairs where the origin was the same as the destination; useful if you only want to calculate access to opportunities that are external to the origins

param.name: join_back_i
param.dialogReference: If selected, joins the accessibility output back to the input origins

tool.summary: The Accessibility Calculator is a Python toolbox for ArcGIS Pro that simplifies the steps involved in a place-based accessibility workflow. The toolbox is part of the paper Accessibility Toolbox for R and ArcGIS published in Transport Findings at DOI https://doi.org/10.32866/8416

dataIdInfo.idCredit: Accessibility Calculator for ArcGIS Pro v2.0 Christopher D. Higgins Department of Human Geography University of Toronto Scarborough https://higgicd.github.io tool help can be found at https://github.com/higgicd/Accessibility_Toolbox
